experience.title: Deputy Manager, Planning dept.
experience.description: Project - Polymer Addition Project, Guru Gobind Singh Refinery, HMEL, Bathinda                                                                                                                              •Involved in a refinery project, construction of Dual Feed Cracker Unit (DFCU), consisting of civil, structure and underground (U/G) piping works                                                                                                                          •Preparation of Monthly look ahead program, Cost to Complete (CTC), Management Information System (MIS) and Word Done Assessment (WDA) report                                              •Monitoring the daily, weekly and monthly progress, comparing the planned vs. achieved progress and pondering the alternatives to catch up the plan     •Coordinating with the site managers, engineers, supervisors along with active participation in the project meetings and discussions with the clientProject - Construction of South Asian University (SAU), Chhattarpur, New Delhi•Appointed on a university construction project, an international project under the Ministry of External Affairs, consisting of 7 different building towers                                                                                                     •Preparation of monthly profit and loss statement (P&L) with the provisions and deferments and declaration of the current profit margin of the project•Mastered the various procedures and techniques of client and sub-contractor billing as per the methodology in IS 1200 and the contractual conditions•Coordinated the various execution tasks such as reinforcement, formwork and concreting works followed by its approval and verification by the client•Took initiatives for time and cost control, better manpower management, increased efficiency and wastage reduction so as to utilize resources effectively
experience.description_html: Project - Polymer Addition Project, Guru Gobind Singh Refinery, HMEL, Bathinda •Involved in a refinery project, construction of Dual Feed Cracker Unit (DFCU), consisting of civil, structure and underground (U/G) piping works •Preparation of Monthly look ahead program, Cost to Complete (CTC), Management Information System (MIS) and Word Done Assessment (WDA) report •Monitoring the daily, weekly and monthly progress, comparing the planned vs. achieved progress and pondering the alternatives to catch up the plan •Coordinating with the site managers, engineers, supervisors along with active participation in the project meetings and discussions with the clientProject - Construction of South Asian University (SAU), Chhattarpur, New Delhi•Appointed on a university construction project, an international project under the Ministry of External Affairs, consisting of 7 different building towers •Preparation of monthly profit and loss statement (P&L) with the provisions and deferments and declaration of the current profit margin of the project•Mastered the various procedures and techniques of client and sub-contractor billing as per the methodology in IS 1200 and the contractual conditions•Coordinated the various execution tasks such as reinforcement, formwork and concreting works followed by its approval and verification by the client•Took initiatives for time and cost control, better manpower management, increased efficiency and wastage reduction so as to utilize resources effectively

projects: [{"title":"Damage detection in structures using Artificial Intelligence Techniques","start_date":"Jul 2016","end_date":"Apr 2017","description":"Implemented Genetic algorithm, Particle swarm optimisation, Ant colony optimisation and Harmony search algorithm for damage detection in trusses, bridges and transmission towers."},{"title":"Attenuation of surface waves","start_date":"Jul 2015","end_date":"Apr 2016","description":"Conducted experiments to find out the medium which causes maximum attenuation to the different types of approaching surface waves such as Ultrasonic Pulse Velocity (UPV) test, Spectral Analysis of Surface Waves (SASW) test, performed analysis using Vibration Exciter, Type 4808 and verified the results by Spectral ratio method"}]
